dc.title: U.S. Bureau of Land Management in California - Take it Outside
dc.description: The official homepage for the Bureau of Land Management (BLM) in California. The BLM manages 15.2 million acres of public lands in California, nearly 15% of the state's land area. BLM also administers 47 million acres of subsurface mineral estate underlying federal surface land, 2.5 million acres underlying privately owned land, 592,000 acres of Native American tribal land where BLM has trust responsibility for mineral operations. BLM California also manages 1.6 million acres in northwestern Nevada for cattle grazing, wild horses, recreation and wildlife habitat.
